column1: [[File:Ron Chironna - Friend of Secret Things.jpg|thumb|[[Ron Chironna]] - ''Friend of Secret Things'']]
'''Kelvar''' was a name used by the [[Valar|Vala]] [[Yavanna]] to refer to that part of her natural realm capable of moving or escaping
column2: as opposed to the [[olvar]] which were rooted in place. The terms kelvar and olvar
column4: refer respectively to animal and plant life
column5: and are essentially equivalent in meaning to fauna and flora.<ref name=S2>{{S|2}}</ref>

column2: some of the kelvar were said to have been inhabited by powerful spirits. Most famous among these were the great [[Eagles]] that overlooked events in [[Middle-earth]] from their mountainous eyries.<ref name=S2/>

column5: p. 363</ref> It has been suggested that ''kelvar'' is a [[Quenya]] word
column6: and that the (unattested) singular form would likely be ''kelva''.<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]]

column1: Other words for "animal" (names which in general only referred to "four-footed beasts
column2: and never to reptiles or birds") were [[Quenya]] ''laman'' (pl. ''lamni'' or ''lamani'')
one of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s early conceptions of an [[Elvish|Elven]] language
column4: animal" is ''cuid''. The word ''meg'' is glossed as "any small animal
